clues.text: He took a cut in rank from major general in the U.S. Army to brigadier general in the British army
His family believed this American spy, disguised as a schoolmaster, was betrayed by a relative
Parliament didn't repeal all of the Townshend Acts in 1770, if left this tax in place
In a July 6, 1775 declaration, this body still hoped for a reconciliation, not a split
The Civil War featured the Monitor vs the Merrimack, the Revolution, the H.M.S Serapis vs this ship
Using 100 million pounds of paper a year, this federal agency is the world's largest printer under one roof
The feature section of this city's Daily News is called "Yo!"
In 1914 publisher Conde Nast started this pattern company, named for a magazine he already owned
In 1954 he became CEO of Harcourt Brace, in 1970 his name was added to the firm's
The Hearst Corporation still owns this West Coast paper, the first in William's empire
The scientific name for this flower is "Lilium tigrinium"
This bell-shaped flower of the primrose family is found in red, white, blue &  of course, "scarlet"
Despite the nursery rhyme, it's neither blue, "Dilly Dilly", nor green; it's pale purple
This colorful violet has been called the "flower with a face"
In a poem by Walt Whitman, type of flowers that "last in the dooryard bloom'd"
This chemist's research into ascorbic acid led to the 1970 book "Vitamin C and the Common Cold"
When he entered the Augustinian monastery at Brunn in 1843, he added Gregor to his given name, Johann

In 1899 he claimed his 20-million volt "coil" passed current around the world sufficient to light 200 lamps
This Frenchman's 1857 paper "On Lactic Fermentation" put forth his germ theory of disease
Watson's Erroneous Deductions is 1 of many societies devoted to this fictional partner of Watson
In 1962 Cuba was suspended from this union of Western Hemisphere nations
When founded in London in 1855, the YWCA sought to find housing for nurses returning from this war
Composer Victor Herbert was among those who founded this music licensing association in 1914
This association, noted for its Christmas Seal campaign, was founded in 1904 to combat tuberculosis
This title of this highest priest of Tibet translates to "ocean chief"
You don't have to speak Yiddish to know it means "a gossipy woman"
Russian for a three-horse sled, it's also three ideas represented metaphorically
Gilbert & Sullivan fans know Japanese emperors once had this title meaning "exalted gate"
We often use this French word for "surroundings" to describe a restaurant's atmosphere
Robert Frost said it consists of "twelve persons chosen to decide who has the better lawyer"
Ironically, it was Abraham Lincoln who said, "The ballot is stronger than" this
Will Rogers once said, "I belong to no organized party -- I am" one of these

This French short story writer called patriotism "the egg from which wars are hatched"
Sir Henry Morgan became Lt. gov. of Jamaica despite his naughty nautical career as one of these
This Welsh singer once billed himself as Tommy Scott, the twisting vocal
A 1989 PBS documentary about this actor was subtitled "In From the Cold"
A Welshman named Owen is considered the founder of this family which ruled England from 1485-1603
This Welsh playwright played a murderer in his own 1935 play "Night Must Fall"
On weather maps isobars connect points of equal pressure & isotherms connect points equal in this
The highest known barometer reading in the U.S., 31.85, was recorded in this state during a 1989 cold wave
During a storm this can occur in a cloud, between clouds or from a cloud to the ground
The wind direction most commonly observed during a given period is called this
The 2 seasons when icebergs are most likely to be formed
In a song from "Oklahoma!", "Everythin's up to date in" this city that's not in Oklahoma
"By the light of" this "I want to spoon, to my honey I'll croon love's tune"
"Many a heart is aching, if you could read them all; many the hopes that have vanished, after" this

clues.text: "Not a soul down on the corner, that's a pretty certain sign, that those wedding bells are" doing this
clues.response: breaking up that old gang of mine

clues.text: The Counter-Reformation was this church's way of trying to check the spread of Protestantism
Tradition holds that this religion's calendar began at creation, 5750 years ago
In 630 Mohammed returned in triumph to this city he had fled in secret about 8 years earlier
In Romans 6:3-4 he likened baptism to sharing in the death, burial & resurrection of Christ
For Zoroastrians it's the Avesta
A way to say goodbye to someone who's taking a trip, it's French for "good journey"
When one actor leaves the stage; it's an "exit"; when more than one leaves, it's called this
From the Latin for "to say farewell", it's the student who says farewell at a graduation ceremony
Title of a 1985 book by William F. Buckley, or a 1956 hit song by Bill Haley & His Comets

rounds.text: In 2001 he published a book called "Banging Your Head Against a Brick Wall"; in 2002, "Existencilism"
